intro: Racosperma botrydion, commonly known as the hairy wattle, is a shrub native to Australia. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its compound leaves and yellow flowers. The plant is distinguished by its hairy stems and leaves, which give it its common name. It thrives in a variety of soil types but prefers well-drained conditions. Racosperma botrydion plays a role in nitrogen fixation, contributing to soil fertility in its native habitat.
